answers.answer: Unfortunately once the nerves have been damaged due to diabetes, there is not a cure.Your mother needs to control her sugar diabetes and also see her doctor.The prescriptions that the doctor can prescribe are antidepressants that work for referred nerve pain.  There are a few different ones available, and pain relief medications.There are foot sprays that can cool the feet, but they won't help when there is nerve damage.She also needs to get her feet checked by a podiatrist as it is important that there is no damage underneath her feet.  Diabetics lose sensitivity and damage can happen before they are aware of it.She also needs to wear good comfortable shoes with insoles if she needs to have them.When your mum sits, get her to raise her legs to rest them.  It won't stop the nerve pain, but is more comfortable.
